section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter describes the rights of patients transported or treated by commercial ambulance services.

section.heading: Patient Rights.
section.text: A commercial ambulance service shall provide each patient:

para.text: Information from the commercial ambulance service necessary in order to give informed consent for transport or treatment, or both;
The opportunity to refuse transport or treatment when the patient is apparently competent to do so;
Reasonable privacy concerning a patient's transportation and care;
Confidentiality of all communications and records relating to patient transportation and care except to the extent otherwise required by law;
Reasonable response to a request for services once the commercial ambulance service is engaged to provide service;
Service that is within reasonable limits of the scheduled pickup and delivery times;
Reasonable continuity of care once the commercial ambulance service is engaged to provide service;
An opportunity to examine and receive an explanation of the patient's bill;
An environment in the commercial ambulance free from recognized hazards and unreasonable annoyances including but not limited to:
Loud conversation by the crew; and
Information that commercial ambulance services operating in Maryland are regulated by the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems.
